topics.body:
Ok guys, being brutally honest, we're all just in a cycle of lingering melancholy now. We're not moving on in the slightest.

Not my words but I thought I'd say them here anyways.

"Go celebrate Iwata's legacy. Defeat Bowser. Save the triforce. Help Ness.

The man may be gone but his work will live on forever.":https://twitter.com/SSF1991/status/620392492072996864
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200
31bee2686368722a0df23600

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a30fa063687246b50013e0#post_55a30fa063687246b50013e0
i feel pretty indifferent too since i dont care too much for Nintendo but even ill mourn for a bit over his loss considering how he was most definitely somebody in this world
topics.author: 4ffbfff37f123b072a01bb5b

topics.body:
It's ok to feel indifferent, we've all had different experiences with Iwata and the games Nintendo has put out with his guidance and assistance

But please, nobody's gonna feel any better if all we do is continue to argue in the midst of all of this.

Mourners are allowed to mourn. Don't be a dick to anyone. Just calm down, move on, and celebrate his legacy if you so wish.
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

Since I don't have anything to contribute here's something funny; my mom almost watched 50 shades of grey not knowing what it was until I told her.  She still doesn't believe me cause she watches lifetime and she doesn't think such a "family friendly genre" could ever be sexual.
